Yes, many ancestral blades were remounted in gunto koshirae and
carried off=
 to the Pacific War.  But they were not stamped with the
Showa cherry bloss=
om.  A Showa stamp, also the nearly as common Seki
stamp, indicates the bla=
de is not completely traditionally made.  In
some better examples that look=
 very traditional, displaying both hada
and water tempered hamon, the stamp=
 indicates it was made with western
style steel instead of the traditional =
tamahagane.

NC

> Yes this is true. Old mounts removed and new military =

several, well more than several. Mark  Happy collecting.
